citations.narrative:
The applicant is not following the vaccination and sampling schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC):
• All adult dogs are not up to date on their Distemper and Parvovirus vaccinations, a required vaccination. The adult dogs
last received the Distemper and Parvovirus vaccines on March 29, 2023. The Program of Veterinary Care prescribes for
these vaccines to be given yearly.
• Sampling for intestinal parasites for adult dogs is not being performed. The PVC states that 10% of all adult dogs will be
tested yearly.
Failure to administer required vaccines in accordance with a veterinary approved schedule leaves the dogs susceptible to
Distemper and Parvovirus, which if contracted, can cause pain, distress, and suffering. Failure to follow a schedule for
parasite sampling may cause the animals to not be adequately protected from diseases and parasites. Correct by
ensuring all animals are vaccinated in accordance with the guidelines and schedule approved by the Attending
Veterinarian and follow the schedule for parasite sampling. Correct by 18-NOV-2024.

The licensee does not maintain medical records for all adult dogs. Records indicate that 4 adult dogs have no medical
records, the Licensee states that these animals did receive Distemper and Parvovirus vaccines last year:
•Adult Female Cavalier King Charles Spaniel (#8498), Adult Female Cavalier King Charles Spaniel (#6068), Adult Female
Cavalier King Charles Spaniel (#2219), and Adult Female Labradoodle (#5805).
Failure to maintain adequate medical records may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the animals
are receiving adequate veterinary care. Complete medical records must be maintained and include the names of all
vaccines and treatments administered and the dates of administration. Correct by documenting all treatments given and
ensure that medical records are complete and contain the required information. Correct by 11-NOV-2024.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a Facility Representative.
n

narrative:
3.13(a)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The applicant is not following the vaccination and sampling schedule in the written Program of Veterinary Care (PVC): 
 
• All adult dogs are not up to date on their Distemper and Parvovirus vaccinations, a required vaccination. The adult dogs 
last received the Distemper and Parvovirus vaccines on March 29, 2023. The Program of Veterinary Care prescribes for 
these vaccines to be given yearly. 
• Sampling for intestinal parasites for adult dogs is not being performed. The PVC states that 10% of all adult dogs will be 
tested yearly. 
 
Failure to administer required vaccines in accordance with a veterinary approved schedule leaves the dogs susceptible to 
Distemper and Parvovirus, which if contracted, can cause pain, distress, and suffering. Failure to follow a schedule for 
parasite sampling may cause the animals to not be adequately protected from diseases and parasites. Correct by 
ensuring all animals are vaccinated in accordance with the guidelines and schedule approved by the Attending 
Veterinarian and follow the schedule for parasite sampling. Correct by 18-NOV-2024. 
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee does not maintain medical records for all adult dogs. Records indicate that 4 adult dogs have no medical 
records, the Licensee states that these animals did receive Distemper and Parvovirus vaccines last year: 
 
•Adult Female Cavalier King Charles Spaniel (#8498), Adult Female Cavalier King Charles Spaniel (#6068), Adult Female 
Cavalier King Charles Spaniel (#2219), and Adult Female Labradoodle (#5805). 
 
Failure to maintain adequate medical records may interfere with the ability of APHIS officials to determine if the animals 
are receiving adequate veterinary care. Complete medical records must be maintained and include the names of all 
vaccines and treatments administered and the dates of administration. Correct by documenting all treatments given and 
ensure that medical records are complete and contain the required information. Correct by 11-NOV-2024.

This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a Facility Representative.
